title: Condoriano is Actually Con D. Oriano - A Member of the Will of D
author: One Piece Community (Meme Theory)
theory: The mysterious 'Condoriano' character that Usopp invented is actually 'Con D. Oriano,' a secret member of the Will of D clan. This humorous fan theory elevates the joke character to mythical status, claiming he's the most powerful character in the series and the true secret 10th Straw Hat member.
evidence: Condoriano appears and disappears mysteriously without explanation
Even the Marines seem to accept his presence despite being in a secure fortress
The name 'Condoriano' can be read as 'Con D. Oriano' following One Piece naming conventions
His casual confidence suggests someone with hidden power
counterEvidence: Condoriano is literally just Usopp's improvised lie about a random Marine
The entire G-8 Arc is filler and not canon to the manga
There's no actual evidence of special powers or D clan connection
communityReception: This theory is intentionally humorous and has become one of the most beloved memes in the One Piece community. Fans regularly joke about Condoriano being the strongest character, and the meme has persisted for nearly 20 years despite being from a filler arc.

title: Jonathan Should Have Been a Recurring Character
author: One Piece Community
theory: Vice Admiral Jonathan was such a well-written and popular character that many fans theorize he should have been made canon and brought back as a recurring Marine antagonist. Some fans believe Oda (the manga creator) might have been inspired by Jonathan's positive reception when creating later intelligent Marine characters.
evidence: Jonathan is widely considered one of the best-written Marine characters
His strategic intelligence and reasonable nature made him memorable
Later canon Marines like Smoker and Fujitora share some of Jonathan's reasonable qualities
The G-8 Arc's popularity demonstrates the character's appeal
counterEvidence: Jonathan is anime-original and has never appeared in the manga
Oda doesn't typically incorporate anime-original characters into canon
The character's story arc was complete within the G-8 episodes
communityReception: Many fans express disappointment that Jonathan never appeared again and wish he could be made canon. This has led to discussions about the quality gap between the G-8 Arc and other filler content.

title: The G-8 Arc Was Originally Planned as Canon
author: One Piece Theorists
theory: Some fans theorize that the G-8 Arc's exceptional quality suggests it might have been originally planned as canon content or that Oda provided substantial input. The arc's perfect placement between Skypiea and Water 7, its use of Skypiea items (Waver, dials), and its character writing quality are cited as evidence.
evidence: The arc perfectly fits the gap between Skypiea and the next canon arc
Makes extensive use of items from Skypiea (Waver, Impact Dial, Octopus Balloon)
Character writing and strategy quality rivals canon content
The ending song was exclusive to this arc, suggesting special treatment
No other filler arc has achieved this level of acclaim
counterEvidence: The manga goes directly from Skypiea to Long Ring Long Land with no G-8 content
No official statements suggest Oda planned this arc
It's more likely the anime staff was simply very talented and cared about quality
Other arcs have had exclusive songs without being originally canon
communityReception: While no evidence supports this theory, it reflects the community's high regard for the arc and desire to explain why it stands so far above other filler content.

title: Nami's Lightning Attack Foreshadows Future Power-Ups
author: One Piece Power-Scaling Community
theory: Nami's powerful lightning attack in this episode foreshadows her future development of even more powerful weather-based combat abilities. Some fans point to this as early evidence that Nami would become a serious combatant, not just a support character.
evidence: This is one of the first times Nami defeats enemies without help using pure combat power
The lightning is strong enough to take down multiple armed Marines
Future arcs show Nami developing even stronger Clima-Tact techniques
This moment proves non-Devil Fruit users can be powerful combatants
counterEvidence: Nami had already shown combat ability in earlier arcs
This is filler content so it's not part of official power progression
The scene might just be anime-original combat flair
communityReception: A minority theory mainly discussed by fans analyzing Nami's combat progression. Most fans see this as just a cool action scene rather than meaningful foreshadowing.
